comments:
Hi,

I did this:

1. Renamed the Eclipse 3.1.0 M6 directory from 'C:\eclipse\' to 'C:\eclipse-
old\'
2. Installed Eclipse 3.1.0 M7 (file eclipse-SDK-3.1M7-win32.zip) 
to 'C:\eclipse\'
3. Installed Cougaar IDE plug-in 1.3.1.2 into M7's directory
4. Ran Eclipse 3.1.0 M7, specifying the workspace that M6 was using
5. Went into the Run --> Run... option
6. Tried to create a new "Cougaar (XML)" configuration, in the "Create, manage, 
and run configurations" window

An error message was displayed, simply saying "An error occurred. See error log 
for more details." (The same happened when trying to create a new "Cougaar 
(INI)" configuration.)

The following was written to the error log (for "Cougaar (XML)"):

-------------------

-------------------

Can anyone help? Or is it a job for the Cougaar guys? The Cougaar IDE version 
I'm using (1.3.1.2) may not be the most recent, but I have no choice but to use 
it.

Thanks,

Mike.

Yes, this is a problem with the cougaar plugin.  It is calling a non-API method
(org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug... is internal package and should not be
referenced). The method was removed in M7, causing the error.  I suggest
reporting this to the originator of that plugin.  They should read this document:

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-API%20use/eclipse-api-usage-rules.html
